name: Conrad Bali

reviews.text: Make no mistake, this is a great hotel. My wife and I took our five year old son who thoroughly enjoyed the large swimming pool and beach lagoon pool. The facilities are top notch, the location is perfect - beach walks north and south every day and we walked to Nusa Dua in about 20 minutes to shop (there is also a free shuttle bus if you want). But the best thing about this hotel is the staff, so polite, courteous and freindly. Expect to pay similar prices to Australia for food and beverage at the hotel. If you are thinking of booking a holiday here, do yourself a favour and make the booking now! We are already planning our next trip back to the Conrad.
reviews.title: The Perfect Stay

reviews.text: An Epic. A real beast of a hotel. The type you see on Getaway that don't actually exist in the real world. But they do - and Conrad Bali is one of them. Firstly it's huge and it has everything - no matter what your game, Conrad delivers. It has seclusion if you want it, social scene, if you want it, huge pools, great restaurants, amazing staff, all the water sport action you would ever need. The business side of things is terrific - conference centre great catering - the place is a real treat and no doubt i'll be back over the next 18 months. There is simply so many staff members you receive constant attention and nothing is too much fuss. I stayed in a suite offering free dry cleaning, discount food, a kiddie free zone, not to mention the suit itself was enormous. If you're doing Bali's elite mass resorts it's Conrad, Ayana or the Grand Hyatt. Being in Nusa Dua also gives you plenty of distance from Kuta - which is absolutely a good thing. Only fault - it didn't have free wifi everywhere - c'mon it's 2010. Seriously.
reviews.title: Con-Radical!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Conrad - 5 stars. Bang!
reviews.title: Conrad Suites are heaven on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Initially booked a "club room" with access to the club lounge. When we got there we realised that this meant an average resort room with access to the club lounge and were not impressed with the average rooms. Furthermore, the quality and quantity of the food in the club lounge was just average. As we paid what appears to be double the price of an average resort room just to have access to the club lounge, we spoke with the assistant manager who listened to our concerns and upgraded us to the Conrad Suites for the remainder of our stay. The Conrad Suites are something else. Truly 5 star luxury and were absolutely beautiful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay from then on, and would recommend going to the Conrad Bali for the Conrad Suites only and not the average resort/club rooms. The resort itself had beautiful pools and grounds.
reviews.title: Luxurious hotel - No 1 for relaxation..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I have been lucky enough to stay at this hotel twice now on Hilton points and love it. We also have no doubt we will return again as soon as we can.
reviews.title: Amazing resort with modern Bali architecture

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a well appointed hotel and pool area. The food is fine, but limited in diversity and pricey. We've had much better food at those prices. For us the service above all else was a disappointment. Important ingredients to make for good service - staff that have their own appreciation of what 5 star service should be or at least a visible management overseeing the service. The staff were pleasant enough but they just didn't appreciate what we expected at those prices. They did not have initiative to deal with anything slightly outside the norm. Management was decidedly absent. We're happy with 2 star, we're happy with 5 star......when you are being asked to pay those respective prices. This hotel got the prices and the service mixed up. It just wasn't Value For Money.
reviews.title: 2 star service for 5 star prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted by many friendly faces when we arrived at the Conrad, their sweeping driveway and lights were impressive enough! We were ushered to their lounge terrace overlooking the pool and given some drinks and a cold towel whilst they arranged our check-in for us. We had booked a deluxe Ocean View villa, and we weren’t disappointed. The view was lovely and the room was nice and spacious. We were greeted with some fruit and a basket of flowers for us to make a bath. The bathroom as amazing, probably the highlight of the room!
reviews.title: Lovely, but overpriced.
Fabulous
reviews.text: We had dinner at their beach side restaurant with a lovely view of the sun setting. The meal itself was lovely, but rather expensive, it came to £50 including a couple of beers (but no starters). We thought Bali was supposed to be cheap…. obviously not at the Conrad! We worked out that we were paying around £3.50 for a small bottle of water, now we’re not stupid and we know we were staying in a nice hotel, but we don’t like feeling ripped off.

Breakfast at the Conrad was included in our room rate, there was plenty of choice, but I wouldn’t rate it too highly. I had an omelette each day which was nice, but with the food being laid out for a few hours, it didn’t look that appealing.
reviews.title: Top class relaxing resort

reviews.text: We spent most of our time by the beach in their “Beach Bales” which were nice and cool next to the sea breeze. These were in the shade as the sun was far too hot (31 degrees whilst we were there). I recommend a minimum of factor 30 to have on all the time. The beach where we were was a bit disappointing, it wasn’t the idyllic Bali beach that I’d had in my head when we were booking the trip. There were speed boats and jet skis whizzing up and down the shoreline all day – very close to the shore, so that you wouldn’t really want to go swimming. When I did venture down to the shore, there was a lot of debris and rubbish being washed up. Not really what I wanted to see. I think the Conrad did clear this away, but it was later in the day, whereas I’d have liked this to have been done first thing in the morning.
reviews.title: Ehhh - Just Okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for our honeymoon. Got upgraded to the pool access room. It has the best bed and pillows of all the hotels we stayed with (intercon, elysian, hard rock). Very very comfy with the luxurious 1000 thread count cover. And also the best room, great attention to detail, although the TV is getting outdated. The spa is also very nice.
reviews.title: Great attention to details

likes.liked: — the room, the bed and pillows

reviews.title: Hated the filthy beach
reviews.text: The beach is very average, nothing compared to the beach of jimbaran. The surrounding area is very quiet, with nothing much going on. Try Bumbu Desa down the road, it serve authentic balinese food. Another must try is the new Tratorria at Jimbaran. They serve amazing italian food, with great atmosphere at a budget price!

This resort hotel is above anything ( even the very recommendable Grand Hyatt resort ) in terms of service, abundance and friendliness of the staff, very generous room layout and size, the pools, the restaurants, the SPA facilities.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, best $200 spent on a hotel
Qulaity hotel
reviews.text: It is, however, horrible when you come for ocean swimming. the beach is filthy, unkempt , and the area warded off for swimming is very small, and it can only be used one or two hours at high tide, as the water is receding quickly afterwards and to an extent that is nearly out of sight.

reviews.text: At high tide, there is a lot of noise and bad smell disturbance because the center for "water sports" ( water motor scooters, Paragliding etc. is near, and these speedboats pass through the swimming area.

reviews.title: Very nice stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had originally booked all 3 rooms with "Club" access, hoping to cut down on the food cost of 4 teenagers. Upon checking in, I was informed that, as Hilton Gold member, all 3 rooms were automatically upgraded to the "Club" level. When I mentioned to the on-duty manager, Darmanto, that I have already booked my rooms as such (and paid a higher price for them), he offered a price reduction for all 3 rooms, right on the spot!
reviews.title: gorgeous resort, relaxing trip

likes.disliked: — paying exorbitant rates for the internet from our room

reviews.text: The rooms were all configured slightly different, but were all beautiful, clean and very, very spacious. We have stayed in many, many nice hotels around the world and the rooms at Conrad Bali is definitely one of the best, especially for the price we paid.
reviews.title: Whoah! Worth every penny!

reviews.text: The Club Lounge was fabulous and very much worth the extra cost. My 18 year old is notorious for not waking up until way past noon, but he got up every morning, just to enjoy the fantastic breakfast spread, a small miracle! That banana pancake is to die for! We all loved (and looked forward to) the afternoon tea service (divine desserts) and evening appetizers. The employees at the Club Lounge were all wonderful and friendly. They were always smiling, even when we were asking for that 4th glass of watermelon juice. The free use of computer and internet at the Lounge was also much appreciated (especially by the 4 teenagers).
reviews.title: Very enjoyable but
Enjoy this place with my family
reviews.text: I spent 6 nights at this hotel with my wife and 2 kids. We all loved it.
I posted some photos at this site www.geocities.com/conradbali
reviews.title: Super Comfortable with great service

likes.disliked: — The beach did not have good snorkeling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We felt very comfortable at the Conrad. The pool complex is fantastic. The room and bathroom was very large with a nice balcony. We had access to the club room and it had a great breakfast selection and nice snack and cocktail time, with delicious tropical cocktails. I don't know about the high season, but we had little trouble getting the comfy beach bales to relax on under a thatched roof, since the sun is unrelenting. Every local you meet is smiling from someone you pass on the street to the hotel workers. You will need some swim shoes for the beach, since it has a lot of shells, which are hard on feet and a quick drop off. This is the kind of place that makes it very hard to leave, since you relax as soon as you walk in the door. They had a sand bottom pools, but they were very shallow, so better for little kids and not as cool as the regular part of the pool. We saw a Balinese wedding at their Bali water garden, which was interesting and a regular wedding at their wedding chapel. The concierge staff was very helpful. Everyone was very kind and helpful and would often greet me by name.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at the Conrad and thoughly enjoyed our stay. The deluxe rooms were spacious, clean and had everything you required. The grounds are extensive, there are 2 main pools, a large 33metre pool and an impressive lagoon pool! There are numerous restaurants and a poolside bar, with yummy cocktails!
reviews.title: Conrad was Beautiful!

reviews.text: This resort is quite large (over 300 rooms), so at peak time might get a bit crowded, but was nice and quiet in Feb. The resort is approx 30 mins from Kuta if you are after shopping and nightlife. Overall a great resort for your stay in Bali!
reviews.title: Return guest

reviews.text: This had been my 9th time vacationing in Bali with my wife in the past 3 years. It was our first time staying at the Conrad however.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel and facilities

likes.liked: — Beautifully appointed luxury rooms, meticulously maintained grounds, excellent staff, general and club facilities.
likes.disliked: — Not the best beach, with some debris despite great effort in beach cleaning. Slow (free) internet access.

reviews.text: Overall, there really wasn't much difference at the Conrad, than the other 4/5 star hotels in the Nusa Dua area. Also, when I complained to a western staff manager, (Not Balinese), about the strong smell of mildew in our room, her response was "This Is Bali". Nothing was changed. I've stayed at the Intercontinental, Grand Hyatt and the Nikkos on several previous trips, without the "attitude" from their western management staff.
reviews.title: Great Resort

reviews.text: I was at the Conrad for a family wedding and it was amazing. The staff are beautiful and welcoming, the rooms are spectacular and gorgeous!! We were able to get joining rooms with our larger family and this made the hotel experience even more amazing!! Oh and the breakfast is to die for!! Thanks you Conrad for this once in a life time experience.
reviews.title: Magical Place

reviews.text: The Conrad is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. A bit of a trip to Kuta/Denpasar but worth it for the benefits the Conrad has to offer. After a busy day out returning to the Conrad was like "coming home". Beautifully appointed rooms, spacious and clean. Superior bathroom products, a full size, separate bath, a choice of pillows (up to 15), and quiet...the place to return to for a proper re-charge and rejuvenate break. From the welcoming drink on arrival, to the fast and friendly check out, this hotel runs like clockwork. I only got to eat breakfast there, but what a breakfast. Again, a spread that would be hard to beat. Highly recommended for the discerning traveller.
reviews.title: Palatial surrounds with a welcoming atmosphere

reviews.text: Conrad hotel at Bali is one of the most fascinating places I have ever visited. A picturistic resort with a lot of fun options. Rooms are very comfortable. Restaurant area and lobby is pool facing with a mind blowing ambience. Overall, its worth the cost.
reviews.title: Heaven with all ingredients for fun and frolic

reviews.text: My colleagues and I were delighted with the level of customer service that was experienced at The Conrad, Bali. From check-in to check-out, every single request was attended to immediately which allowed for a very successful business trip. The food was amazing, the setting beautiful and the staff - fantastic! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone heading to Bali for business or wanting to relax and be spoilt. It was a shame we couldn't stay longer on this visit, however, we will definitely return for a proper holiday soon!
reviews.title: The Best I've Experienced!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite having to be in a cab 20 minutes longer than if the hotel was located in Kuta, the welcome of security and an uphill curving driveway beckons what is yet to come in this fab resort. The bellhops and receptionists were very friendly and picked up the tone that we are not middle aged stuffy travelers. The check-in was done without a glitch, while we received a much needed cold facetowel to wipe off the humidity. We were brought to the room which was located on the third wing, which took ages to get to because of the size of the property and were ushered in to a very comfortable and spacious room. The bathroom was spacious and well stocked with amenities. Bottled water was freely available and re-stocked with a phone call to Room Service. Everyone should know that drinking water from the tap is not a good idea so it is a welcome surprise that the Conrad provided the bottled waters free of charge. It's also bottled in glass so fingers crossed there is some recycling happening somewhere in the island.
reviews.title: Civilised Retreat Away from Kuta

description: Conrad Bali is a luxury beachfront resort located on the southern coast of Bali. Contemporary in design, the resort offers 353 guest rooms and suites, inspired dining options, a variety of event venues, with extensive meeting, wedding and leisure facilities, including the Jiwa Spa.
